titlestmt.titleproper: Comstock Park, MI. Comstock Park Congregational Church records, 1888-2021.
titlestmt.author: William McCarthy

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday September 23, 2021 at 16:07

did.unittitle: Comstock Park, MI. Comstock Park Congregational Church records, 1888-2021.
did.abstract: On March 22, 1910, nineteen people gathered for a meeting called by Charles G. Marshall to discuss forming a church in order to fulfill the community's religious needs. As a result of the discussion, the Comstock Park Congregational Church officially formed with thirty-nine members on July 7, 1910. The church moved online once the Covid-19 pandemic started in 2020 and while they saw increased engagement online, it would not be enough to keep the church going. A final service was held in November 2020. This collection contains records from across the Churches life and includes various church organizations, financial documents, pastoral records, vital statistics, visual material, letters, histories, administrative records, reports, and meeting minutes.

corpname.part: Comstock Park Congregational Church (Comstock Park, MI.)

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Comstock Park, MI. Comstock Park Congregational Church records, 1888-2021, RG5418. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library by Joyce Mellena in March 2021; 2021-01.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by William McCarthy, September 2021, using DACS second edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: On March 22, 1910, nineteen people gathered for a meeting called by Charles G. Marshall to discuss forming a church in order to fulfill the community's religious needs. As a result of the discussion, the Comstock Park Congregational Church officially formed with thirty-nine members on July 7, 1910. Reverend S. T. Morris would serve as the first minister until 1914 and helped get the church organized. The church entered the Grand Rapids Association of Congregational Churches on March 5, 1912.

The church building was originally occupied by a small Baptist congregation who transferred ownership of the building in 1915. A parsonage was donated in 1928 and both buildings were transferred to a new space donated by the North family. The building went through various upgrades and changes over the years but remained in the same location.

The church saw declines throughout the 1970s and at one point closure was recommended by the UCC Michigan Conference. The church rallied in the following years but a divisive minister in the early 2000s led to a diminished number of members. The church moved online once the Covid-19 pandemic started in 2020 and while they saw increased engagement online, it would not be enough to keep the church going. A final service was held in November 2020.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains records from the Comstock Park Congregational Church and includes various church organizations, financial documents, pastoral records, vital statistics, visual material, letters, histories, administrative records, reports, and meeting minutes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been arranged into four series and sixteen sub-series. The records in each series has been arranged chronologically by start date except in the reports and meeting minutes.

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: To access the CD's in this collection requires the use of a computer with disk drive.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: 1. DeBoer, Terry. "Behind the Closing Doors part 1 and 2" West Michigan Christian News, Jan. 14, 2021. 2. "Comstock Park Congregational Church Golden Anniversary". (Comstock Park, Michigan, 1960).

corpname.part: Comstock Park Congregational Church (Comstock Park, MI.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to pastors, such as sermons, call agreements, memories, services and a support form.

did.unittitle: A Sermon by Christian Van Der Veen
Is Love the Greatest Thing in the World by Christian Van Der Veen
On babies by Christian Van Der Veen
Michigan Conference notice on call agreements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains church records such as vital statistics, visual materials, reports, meeting minutes, administrative, histories, newsletters, and letters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains vital statistics such as membership, baptisms, deaths, marriages, dismission requests, directories and officer lists.

did.unittitle: Active membership list with vital statistics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains visual materials from the Church and includes scrapbooks, photos, drawings and maps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains various reports and minutes, including Trustees minutes, annual reports, Council meeting minutes, UCC yearbook reports, Church committee reports, board minutes, clerk reports, and the nomination committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains administrative records such as constitutions, event reports, yearbooks and certificates.

did.unittitle: Guests at the Annual Chicken Dinner
United Church of Christ presents Our Church
Grand Rapids Association constitution and by-laws

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains recorded histories of the church from the church historian and an article on the church's closure.

did.unittitle: Behind the Closing Doors by Terry DeBoer
Notes from a Comstock Park Church history talk

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains newsletters including the Good Tidings, Parish Visitor and the Church Window.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains various letters from and to the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records for organizations such as the Deaconess Board, Ladies Aid Society, Women's Fellowship, Misner Circle, Barnes Circle, Ladies Circle, Diaconate council, educational groups, and more.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains records related to various educational groups, such as the Sunday School, Young People's group, music department, and the board of Christian education.

did.unittitle: Pilgrim Fellowship and Young People's reports
Board of Christian Education meeting minutes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains meeting and financial records of the Deaconess Board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains financial records and meeting minutes of the Ladies Aid society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains one-off records from groups such as the Ladies Guild, Leva Barnes Circle, Ethel Lamoreaux Circle, and the Frances Shaw Circle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains reports, meeting minutes, financial records and by-laws of the Women's Fellowship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains financial records of the Misner Circle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains records and treasurer reports for the Barnes Circle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains records of the Ladies Circle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains meeting and council minutes for the Diaconate council. In the earlier records they spelled it "Diakonate" but the records seem to be for the same group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to finances and includes receipts, treasurer's reports, donations, building funds, budgets, non-profit reports, balance sheets, and parsonage records.

did.unittitle: Letters and notes related to church finances
Letters and notes related to church finances
Donation in the name of Zella Mutchler
